title: Product of Conjugates Pattern
text: We compare our expression to the product of conjugates pattern formula: $$\left(a-b\right) \left(a+b\right)=a^2-b^2$$.
speech: We compare our expression to the product of conjugates pattern formula:  parentheses a minus b,  times, parentheses a plus b,  is equal to, a squared minus b squared .
pacedSpeech: We compare our expression to the product of conjugates pattern formula:    a minus b,  times,  a plus b,  is equal to, a squared minus b squared

title: Compare the Binomials\n
text:
In a conjugate pair, it does not matter which binomial comes first, as long as one binomial is a sum and the other is a difference.
$$\left(a-bight) \left(a+bight)$$
$$\left(a+bight) \left(a-bight)$$
$$\left(b+ rac{6}{7}ight) \left(b- rac{6}{7}ight)$$

title: Identify $$b$$

title: Plug in the Terms
text: Substitute $$a=b$$ and $$b=\frac{6}{7}$$ into the product of conjugates pattern formula:\n$$\left(a+b\right) \left(a-b\right)=a^2-b^2$$\n$$\left(b+\frac{6}{7}\right) \left(b-\frac{6}{7}\right)=b^2-{\left(\frac{6}{7}\right)}^2$$
speech: Substitute  a is equal to b  and  b, is equal to 6 sevenths  into the product of conjugates pattern formula:\n parentheses a plus b,  times, parentheses a minus b,  is equal to a squared minus b squared \n parentheses, b plus 6 sevenths,  times, parentheses, b minus 6 sevenths,  is equal to b squared minus, parentheses 6 sevenths  squared
